title: PCL: Proposal Cluster Learning for Weakly Supervised Object Detection
abstract:
Weakly Supervised Object Detection (WSOD), using only image-level annotations
to train object detectors, is of growing importance in object recognition. In
this paper, we propose a novel deep network for WSOD. Unlike previous networks
that transfer the object detection problem to an image classification problem
using Multiple Instance Learning (MIL), our strategy generates proposal
clusters to learn refined instance classifiers by an iterative process. The
proposals in the same cluster are spatially adjacent and associated with the
same object. This prevents the network from concentrating too much on parts of
objects instead of whole objects. We first show that instances can be assigned
object or background labels directly based on proposal clusters for instance
classifier refinement, and then show that treating each cluster as a small new
bag yields fewer ambiguities than the directly assigning label method. The
iterative instance classifier refinement is implemented online using multiple
streams in convolutional neural networks, where the first is an MIL network and
the others are for instance classifier refinement supervised by the preceding
one. Experiments are conducted on the PASCAL VOC, ImageNet detection, and
MS-COCO benchmarks for WSOD. Results show that our method outperforms the
previous state of the art significantly.
